title: In New Iraqi Conflict, 'Sunni Awakening' Stays Dormant
teaser: During the U.S. war in Iraq, American forces paid Sunni tribal leaders in the western and northern regions of the country to turn against al-Qaida. The episode was called the "Sunni Awakening." But now, with ISIS consolidating its gains in these same regions, the tribes involved in the Awakening are cutting deals with the militant group or staying on the sidelines entirely. Shashank Bengali of The Los Angeles Times explains.
contentencoded: Copyright 2014 NPR. To see more, visit http://www.npr.org/.
